comments.commentBody: Gee, wmar.  Do you ever leave your alternative reality?

wmar, I avoid reading your nonsense and also try to avoid addressing you, as you always twist things. But I have to say your exploitation of what I said entirely misses my point. which is relevant to the topic at hand. Your choice to use it to denigrate the IPCC is depressingly irrelevant, as you so often are.

These people are actually trying to do something, and they are applying some original thought to it, too sophisticated for me, and with your constant agenda, entirely invisible to you.

They deserve more respect than I have given them, but your use of my response is just disgusting.

Susan,

It is in the end about the allocation of scarce resources and open minds. I cut through your nonsense to point that out.

"These people are actually trying to do something, and they are applying some original thought to it, too sophisticated for me...".

"They deserve more respect than I have given them"

On this we agree.

Dale McIntyre --- On the floor below my office there is the School of Mechanical and Materials Engineering. Some there do aspects of nuclear engineering, primarily related to Hanford cleanup, but some research materials for nucleonic environments. Progress is being made. I remain optimistic that the 14.1 MeV neutron problem can be solved but the cost of solutions remains open.

I'm quite sure that ITER will work. One faculty member downstairs is designing the deuterium machine gun for it. That isn't enough to demonstrate economic feasibility and we are out of time for deployment.

Dee. Try watching Fox more often. You might find that the three debate moderators often ask Republican politicians questions that they would prefer not to answer, as was lamely conceded by Mahler's article.
Which of your favored news outlets shows a similar inclination in pressing Mrs. Clinton?

Libertarianism and corporatization of our culture has diminished humanity.  Everything, including us, is a commodity.  Humanity is always diminished when it's an 'all about me' culture.  The Donald's narcissism exemplifies this, sadly.  We should be very, very scared!

Egomaniacally disgusting, boring, and ugly.

What has happened to our common humanity?
Not unless Kelly delivers the news while wearing a bikini or answers questions about what great-looking women can do to further the cause of world peace.
I am no fan of Trump, but your criticism could just as easily be leveled at any of the Republican candidates this year.

Kim Kardashian can dominate the news cycle. Caitlin Jenner too. Dominating a ratings-hungry news media does not make one "presidential". Are your standards really that low? Are you the least bit interested in a candidates grasp of policy? Diplomatic skills? Or is bombast and bluster your only metric in measuring worthiness for the office?

It looks to me like Trump is looking the MOST presidential after this whole fiasco.
Think about it, he started the debate in the weakest position of all candidates in terms of traditional preparedness for the presidency, and he has exited by taking total command of the news cycle, and how has the network (FOX) treading lightly to make sure they don't alienate him for fear of loosing his support and the money that comes from his "power of attention."

Think about that in terms of process, and apply it to negotiations with congress, or in foreign policy. He totally has flipped the entire issue in his favor! How is that NOT presidential????

Trust me, anyone reading this column know what's going on here what's disturbing is a journalist thinking we need someone to "analyze" it for us. Feels like something you might hear on Fox News. Why not an analysis on the record of every contestant, pardon me, candidate's record on women's issues. That's the story. Man up.

"The cult of personality that Trump is building should give us serious pause whether we are liberals, conservatives, or moderates. He tells big lies and then become enraged when anyone suggest that he is wrong."

Worked for Cheney/Rumsfeld/GWBush, looks like Jeb is ready to run with that strategy too.
Thank you!!!  NY Times, like most corporate media ignore Bernie Sanders.  Completely irresponsible.
"Trump." "Bernie Sanders." "Megyn." Subtle, but telling.

The only reason the war between Trump and Fox has become mutually beneficial is because all the other mainstream news outlets, including the New York Times, CNN, MSNBC, etc, have decided that the entertainment value of that war trumps their responsibility to provide legitimate and intelligent coverage to the American people of the campaign for President. Using an excuse of some un-quantifiable, fictitious risk should a sober-minded media outlet like the Times ignore the self-serving circus act of Megyn and the Donald going at it is utter nonsense. You think we want to turn on our TV and see Trump on every channel? You think we want to open our computer to read about Bernie Sanders drawing over 25,000 supporters in city after city on the West coast, only to find nothing about it because the Times has decided that the only candidates that matter are Trump and Clinton?
Report on the ideas that matter. Risk something, we beg you.

Fox News thought that it could scuttle The Donald's campaign in the first debate. First they demanded a loyalty oath: would he endorse the Republican nominee whoever it may be? Maybe Fox thought he would hem and haw; he didn't. He said no. Then Megyn Kelly tried to bring him down with his repulsive comments about women. She failed. Then Fox tried to prove that he wasn't really a Republican. They found out his supporters don't really care. Finally, after the debate, Fox showed a so-called focus group that concluded Trump had lost the debate. With all of this Donald Trump, the showman, still came out on top. Fox News has egg on its face, and doesn't know what to do next.

Trump may indeed be a snake-oil salesman, but he sure is trouble for the Republicans. He can fool a lot of people most of the time.
He may be honest about what he thinks, but that doesn't mean he's right or should be rewarded for it.

Any of those other candidates have any serious plans or ideas in that debate?  I guess not, or we might have heard about them.  And what about the other 7?  At the circus there appears to be no end to the number of clowns you can get into a car.
The last two decades or so of the "Republican war on education" had Dems in the White House twice as long as Reps.

That 24 million people watched Reality Show Politics Debate 1 is testimony to decades of the successful Republican war on education.  Education may be out of reach for most young people but Fox is right there to tell them what they should know.

We should have had this guy sitting across the Iranians to negotiate that deal !

Love him or loath him, Trump is a throwback to tough (and principled) leaders - like Harry Truman - who made America great !

Fight for exactly what, Ray?

Please tell me that The Donald has secretly told you more than he is telling the rest of us, which is nothing. All blister, all bragging, no substance.

That is The Donald.

In all seriousness, he may be wanting Senator Sanders to take the mantle.
He too can not be bought.
He speaks his mind and he is telling us the truth about where we are in how we steward the earth and ourselves.
I am grateful two both of them for the candor and the exposure.
They are performing a great service to us.
I will be voting for Independent Senator Bernie Sanders
He has compassion, intellect, forward thinking and experience.
He is a serious person and realizes the imminent dangers that we are in now.
He shows wisdom in how he choses to speak. He understands the power of words.
And he listens!!

Trump says some horrible things but I love that he upsets the establishment.   He is taking on everyone, from Clinton, to any Republican candidate that crosses him, to Fox News itself and Murdoch.  That is the kind of fire we need in our leader.  Never give up.  Fight hard and fight to the finish.
Reality check isn't little early to even be thinking of elections,this just deversion from whats really coming . Don't retire because people in for rude awaking when comes to social security

It must be catching. Everytime I listen to CNN,MSNBC,CBS,ABC,NBC and read the NYT I get disoriented and start to gag.
It stops when I read the WSJ, Financial Times , Times of London and sometimes the WP.
I think it is a left-wing affliction. A automatic loss of 30% of your I.Q.!

My theory, based on the Fox "debate":

First the facts: Till the debate I have never watched Fox "News" - nor since I might add. Indeed, I had to stop watching about 20 minutes before it ended. As the craziness coming from the mouths of candidates left me feeling disoriented.

Now the theory: Could Fox News, along with the nonsense it purveys, be contributing to the rise in dementia? Or are its adherents already demented enough as to tolerate hours of cognitively disorienting material?

I, for one, will not subject myself to any further endangerment of my mental faculties. Let the viewer beware!
AS Gertrude Stein said of Oakland "There is no there there."  Dead air is an anathema in broadcastimg.
"Ms. Kelly," but "Trump." There it is. If she is as good as she says, or as good as so many people believe her to be, why isn't she just "Kelly?"
I'm not sure which is more ludicrous. That Trump thinks he's a presidential candidate or that Ms. Kelly calls herself a journalist.

When we had a lovely, rambunctious lab, he used to revel in leaping into a lake and get all the geese flying about.  This is what I enjoy so much about Donald Trump.  He's got all the candidates, moderators, and pundits flying about, trying to figure out the sophisticated and (typically) sanctimonious thing to say.  The only convincing antidote I see to all the nonsense, the only person who can convincingly bring it all to an end, is Bernie Sanders.  (Another of the refreshing attributes of Mr. Trump is his refusal to put himself forward as a member of the God squad.)

Really. and no reports of 19,000 people to see Bernie Sanders last night in Los Angeles. and 9,000 who were turned away. He's drawing crowds much larger than any of the other candidates. I think they're more scared of giving any traction to Sanders then they are of the Casino owner Trump.
The paper of record is giving this kind of prominence to a joke of a candidate on a joke of a network. Ay yi yi.

Mr. Jefferson replies:
“Sure, take away my dinner. Take my Memorial while your at it.
But while you're at it, please return to me the following:
Your nation's Independence, which I declared. See how you like living under the English, and Prince Charles, again. And bangers for breakfast, instead of bacon.
And the two-party system, that Mr. Madison and I set up. A mixed blessing, sure. But see how’d you like living in a one-party state, as under King George, or Kim Jong-Un.
Also, the 530,000,000 acres from my Louisiana Purchase. Monetary compensation will do. Say, $3 trillion.
And some fairness about me and slavery. I was far from perfect, heaven knows. But in my Northwest Ordinance, along with establishing a decentralized, county system of democratic government for every new state, I outlawed slavery north of the Mason-Dixon line. And I backed a nation for freed slaves in Liberia, which my protégé Mr. Monroe established. I also wrote a sweeping condemnation of the slave trade in my original Declaration, before it got edited out. But I got my revenge: as President I signed into law a ban on the worst thing about forced servitude--the horrific Passage from Africa of countless slaves, outlawing the import of any more unfortunates into the USA.
I’d suggest adding to the rich fabric of our history instead of deleting from it.

http://www.amazon.com/Foundering-Fathers-Jefferson-Franklin-Abigail-eboo...

Don't strain yourself too hard. Bull Connor was a democrat and remained one all his life! He still votes democrat...  Another lib who doesn't know the history of the democrat party! Wanna talk about Robert Byrd? Al Gore Sr? Estes Kefauver? J Wm Fulbright? LBJ? Woodrow Wilson? FDR?

Fox News and the Wall Street Journal have been gunning for Donald Trump for months and yes, the questions the panelists asked were meant to wound him and were loaded in favor of Jeb Bush. The gambit backfired and now we have the spectacle of Roger Ailes making nice with the man who could be seen as the nemesis of the Republican Party Establishment and it all started with the Tea Party being given prime air time on Fox to spout their brand of nonsense.

Talk about a saga, if DT wasn't so scary, it would be the best show around.
Man, I love a lot of these (and some leave me... meh).  But the ones I love I really love. Interesting photos for me because I'm definitely in a color phase and feel of no particular genre.

Everything you say is true...but where would we be as a people when we choose who is worthy through the eyes of today?  The Democratic party of today has gone out of their way to exclude not only tens of millions of Americans of today, but now they are shedding those who defined the greatest experiment in government the world has ever seen.  Adams, and his son John Quincy, were great Americans whom history has not appreciated...I guess the one good thing of this silly shedding of Jefferson is maybe John and John Quincy may get their due.

Please see my husband's photo essays at www.alan-friedlob.com entitled "Havana Agua" and "Old Chevys Never Die" taken March 2015. In black and white, these photo essays aim at seeing the very complicated Cuba of today. No stereotypic imagery here.
